children.value: Prepare a long image in which the logo is tied together. The image I used here is

Arrange two images consecutively and wrap them in div tags. The images should not be responsive so it's mandatory to specify the height and width properly. The div tag that wraps the images should be the 2 times of the image's width(
) because the image should be aligned horizontally.
Wrap it one more with a
div so that the container does not leave the viewport.
Next, define an infinite loop css animation
that moves the x-axis as much as the image size.
That's it! Isn't it really that simple, right?
Furthermore, we can delay the image loading and scroll animation as shown in the code below.
// animate only when it's visible to save computing resource
